intro: Planchonella polymorpha, commonly known as the variable satinash, is a tropical tree native to the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and elliptical leaves that are usually革质 (leathery) in texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by edible, round fruits resembling small oranges. Its fruit contains a single seed enclosed in a fleshy, aromatic pulp. Planchonella polymorpha is often found in coastal and lowland rainforests, where it thrives in humid, warm climates.
